intro: Paronychia albomarginata, commonly known as the white-margin sandwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers with prominent white margins, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, adapting to arid conditions. Paronychia albomarginata thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland dune environments.
